ORDER

This Crl.M.C. under Section 482 of Cr.P.C. is filed
at the instance of the sole accused in C.C. No.1141 of
2021 on the file of Chief Judicial Magistrate of First Class,
Malappuram, to direct the learned Magistrate to enlarge
the validity of passport stipulated in Annexure B order
dated 6.1.2024 by three years.

2. Learned counsel for the petitioner would
contend that the petitioner was facing the trial for
offences punishable under Section 406 and 498A read
with Section 34 of the Indian Penal Code. He filed C.M.P.
No.30 of 2024 before the learned Magistrate for renewing
his passport for a period of three years for the purpose of
going abroad for employment. But as per Annexure B

sae

2024/KER/3552

order dated 6.1.2024, the learned Magistrate granted
permission for renewal and to obtain a new passport valid
for one year only. According to the petitioner, he is
intending to go to Europe, for which, he should have a
passport valid for minimum three years. But the learned
Magistrate overlooked that fact, and granted permission
for renewal and to get a new passport, valid for one year
only.

3. Heard learned counsel for the petitioner and
learned Public Prosecutor.

4. Based on the facts pleaded and the purpose of
the petition, this Court is inclined to allow this Crl.M.C.,
directing the JFCM, Malappuram to revisit his order dated
6.1.2024 in C.M.P.No.30 of 2024 and to pass appropriate
orders, taking note of the purpose for which the renewal
of the passport was asked for, within a period of one
week from the date of receipt of a copy of this order. The
Registry of this Court is directed to forward a copy of this
